column1: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close.

column13: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.

column1: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

column9: Its muscles never cramp however much it trains. It lives in the mountains away from humans.

column13: It likes food that's highly nutritious because its instincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.
column14: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a <<0075grav>> on its shoulders.

column1: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

column3: Although it is incredibly strong, it is always modest. It restrains its strength with a power-save belt.
column4: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
column5: The muscles covering its body teem with power. Even when still, it exudes an amazing sense of strength.

column13: A popular motif for sculptures, its incredibly well-developed muscles have captured the imagination of many an artist.
column14: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.

column1: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

column4: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

column14: With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It's said to have mastered every martial art in the world.

column1: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.

column8: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.

column1: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
column2: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is melted inside by strong acids.
column3: Armed with razor-sharp leaves, it uses toxic pollen to immobilize its enemy and melts the helpless foe with Acid.
column4: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
column5: If its prey is bigger than its mouth, it slices up the victim with sharp leaves, then eats every morsel.

column9: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

column1: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

column8: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honey-like scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.

column1: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
column2: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
column3: Fires beams of light from its clear eyes. Floats around in shallow waters and may sting unwary anglers.
column4: When the tide goes out, dehydrated Tentacool remains can be found washed up on the shore.

column14: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.

column1: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

column13: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.

column1: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

column12: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.

column16: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.

column5: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you'll be in for a painful shock.

column4: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

column12: It tumbles down slopes, heedless of any body parts chipping off. It eats a ton of rocks daily.
column13: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.

column5: When it comes rolling down a mountain path, anything in its way gets zapped by electricity and sent flying.

column16: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.

column10: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.

column9: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.

column13: Although their tails, which fall off naturally, can easily be found lying around, they're a precious ingredient for cooking.

column15: When this Pokémon's tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

column1: The <<0090shel>> that latches onto <<0079slow>>'s tail is said to feed on the host's leftover scraps.
column2: Lives lazily by the sea. If the <<0090shel>> on its tail comes off, it becomes a <<0079slow>> again.
column3: If its tail is bitten by a <<0090shel>>, <<0079slow>> evolves into Slowbro. The <<0090shel>> seems to like its crunchy tail.
column4: If the tail-biting <<0090shel>> is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary <<0079slow>>.
column5: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to <<0090shel>>'s seeping poison.
column6: An attached <<0090shel>> won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
column7: Its tail has a <<0090shel>> firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This forces it to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
column8: When a <<0079slow>> went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a <<0090shel>>. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
column9: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the <<0090shel>> on its tail bites down.
column10: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With <<0090shel>>'s poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
column11: Whenever <<0090shel>> bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.
column12: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into <<0079slow>> if its tail, along with <<0090shel>>, breaks off.
column13: <<0090shel>>, in its greed to suck out more and more sweetness from Slowbro's tail, has metamorphosed into a spiral-shaped shell.
column14: <<0079slow>> became Slowbro when a <<0090shel>> bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the <<0090shel>> feel as if its life is a dream.
column15: Being bitten by a <<0090shel>> shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the <<0090shel>> lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a <<0079slow>>.

column1: A <<0090shel>> bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokémon.
column2: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the <<0090shel>> biting it, the <<0090shel>> will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.

column1: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
column2: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
column3: Appears as if out of nowhere. It floats using anti-gravity and discharges electricity from two side-mounted units.
column4: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
column5: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
column6: The electricity emitted by the units on each side of its body cause it to become a strong magnet.
column7: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
column8: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
column9: The units at its sides are extremely powerful magnets. They generate enough magnetism to draw in iron objects from over 300 feet away.
column10: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
column11: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
column12: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
column13: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
column14: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.
column15: Perhaps because electrical lines are often buried these days, the number of Magnemite attacks on power plants has increased.
column16: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it'll start moving again.
column17: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

column1: Formed by <<0081magn>> that link together when the number of black spots on the sun increases. Fires high-voltage power, etc.
column2: It is actually three <<0081magn>> linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
column3: Three <<0081magn>> are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
column4: The <<0081magn>> are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.
column5: When many Magneton gather together, the resulting magnetic storm disrupts radio waves.
column6: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
column7: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.
column8: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
column9: When three <<0081magn>> link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
column10: It has about three times the electrical power of <<0081magn>>. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
column11: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.
column12: When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather in high places to wait for lightning to strike.
column13: This Pokémon is three <<0081magn>> that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
column14: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.
column15: Three <<0081magn>> gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.

column1: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.
column2: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetch'd are rarely seen, so it's thought their numbers are decreasing.
column3: Always carries the stalk of an unidentified plant. The stalk is said to be used for making a nest or as a weapon.
column4: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.
column5: If it eats the plant stick it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stick.
column6: In order to prevent their extinction, more people have made an effort to breed these Pokémon.
column7: Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
column8: It is always seen with a stick from a plant. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This Pokémon occasionally fights with others over choice sticks.
column9: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
column10: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
column11: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
column12: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
column13: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

column1: The Farfetch'd of the Galar region are brave warriors, and they wield thick, tough leeks in battle.
column2: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetch'd that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.

column1: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
column2: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
column3: A Pokémon with two heads. More skilled at running than flying, it is capable of racing at speeds over 60 mph.
column4: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
column5: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.
column6: It lives on a grassy plain where it can see a long way. If it sees an enemy, it runs away at 60 mph.
column7: Doduo's two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
column8: Doduo's two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
column9: Even while eating or sleeping, one of the heads remains always vigilant for any sign of danger. When threatened, it flees at over 60 miles per hour.
column10: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
column11: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

column1: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head is said to stay awake.
column2: One of <<0084dodu>>'s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
column3: The three heads express joy, sorrow and anger as they plan strategy together. When it sleeps, one head remains awake.
column4: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.
column5: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
column6: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.
column7: Watch out if Dodrio's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pokémon if it's being wary-it may decide to peck you.
column8: Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
column9: A peculiar Pokémon species with three heads. It vigorously races across grassy plains even in arid seasons with little rainfall.
column10: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

column1: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick icebergs.
column2: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
column3: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
column4: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
column5: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
column6: The light blue fur that covers it keeps it protected against the cold. It loves iceberg filled oceans.
column7: Seel hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
column8: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
column9: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
column10: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

column1: It stores thermal energy in the body. It swims at a steady eight knots even in intensely cold waters.
column2: Its entire body is a snowy-white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
column3: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
column4: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
column5: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's cold.
column6: It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
column7: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
column8: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
column9: Its streamlined body has low resistance, and it swims around cold oceans at a speed of eight knots.
column10: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of <<0746wish>>.
column11: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.
column12: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

column1: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
column2: Made of hardened sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.
column3: Sludge that was transformed when exposed to X-rays from the moon. Loves sludge, industrial waste and other refuse.
column4: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new Grimer emerge. This worsens the stench around it.
column5: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.
column6: When two of these Pokémon's bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
column7: Grimer's sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
column8: Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ- infested fluid from all over its body.
column9: Born from polluted sludge in the sea, Grimer's favorite food is anything filthy. They feed on wastewater pumped out from factories.
column10: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
column11: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
column12: Its main source of food is the slimy industrial waste of factories. This Pokémon's numbers have been decreasing in recent years.
column13: It was born from sludge transformed by exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its internal load of germs decreases, it dies.
column14: It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a sterile environment, the germs within its body can't multiply, and it dies.
column15: The wastewater coming from factories is clean these days, so Grimer have nothing to eat. They're said to be on the verge of extinction.
column16: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.

column1: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.
column2: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.
column3: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.
column4: Brought to Alola to solve the garbage problem, Grimer seems to relish any and all kinds of trash.
column5: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.

column1: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
column2: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
column3: Becomes indistinguishable if it hides in dirt. Touching its sludge-covered body causes horrible poisonings.
column4: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
column5: Its body is made of a powerful poison. Touching it accidentally will cause a fever that requires bed rest.
column6: As it moves, a very strong poison leaks from it, making the ground there barren for three years.
column7: From Muk's body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this Pokémon's body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
column8: This Pokémon's favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
column9: It prefers warm and humid habitats. In the summertime, the toxic substances in its body intensify, making Muk reek like putrid kitchen garbage.
column10: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
column11: The stench it gives off will make your nose scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think that's a good thing.
column12: After recent environmental improvements, this Pokémon is now hardly seen at all. People speculate that it may go extinct at some point.
column13: Their food sources have decreased, and their numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds are being built to prevent their extinction.
column14: Because they scatter germs everywhere, they've long been targeted for extermination, leading to a steep decline in their population.

column1: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its exceedingly vivid coloration.
column2: While it's unexpectedly quiet and friendly, if it's not fed any trash for a while, it will smash its Trainer's furnishings and eat up the fragments.
column3: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.
column4: What look like fangs and claws are actually crystallized poison that will afflict you at a mere touch, so don't get too close.
column5: Muk's coloration becomes increasingly vivid the more it feasts on its favorite dish–trash.

column1: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
column2: Its shell is harder than diamond. It hides in sand on the sea floor and catches prey with its soft tongue.
column3: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
column4: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
column5: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
column6: At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor with its broad tongue to make a place to sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
column7: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
column8: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
column9: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
column10: This Pokémon's tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.
column11: The sand that accumulates inside its shell eventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets in the way, so it spits it out and discards it.
column12: Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still hangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank, the shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.

column1: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
column2: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
column3: Its shell is so hard, it can even withstand a bomb. No one has ever seen what is inside its shell.
column4: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
column5: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
column6: Even a missile can't break the spikes it uses to stab opponents. They're even harder than its shell.
column7: It swims in the sea by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. The Cloyster shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
column8: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
column9: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
column10: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon's shell.
column11: If areas of Cloyster's very hard shell get damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing into large sharp spikes.
column12: <<0079slow>> tails are its favorite food. It has even been known to come up on land to look for <<0079slow>> from time to time.

column1: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
column2: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
column3: Made of a thin, gas-like substance that induces fainting if you get enshrouded in it. Will not appear if it is very windy.
column4: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
column5: Its thin body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
column6: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
column7: When exposed to a strong wind, a Gastly's gaseous body quickly dwindles away. They cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
column8: A Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
column9: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
column10: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it's near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
column11: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.
column12: Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It's said that the remaining 5% is made up of the souls of those who died from the gas.
column13: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.

column1: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
column2: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.
column3: If you trip and fall for no apparent reason or hear a sound when no one is around, it may be a Haunter.
column4: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
column5: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
column6: It hides in the dark, planning to take the life of the next living thing that wanders close by.
column7: If a Haunter beckons you while it is floating in darkness, don't approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
column8: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
column9: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
column10: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
column11: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
column12: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
column13: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it's best not to go out walking around.
column14: It's dangerous to go outside alone on nights when you're feeling sad. Haunter will catch you, and you won't be able to go back home.
column15: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.

column1: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
column2: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.
column3: Appears to attack people who get lost in the mountains. Said to be the culprit behind shadows that laugh in the moonlight.
column4: It steals heat from its surroundings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a Gengar appeared.
column5: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
column6: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
column7: Deep in the night, your shadow cast by a streetlight may suddenly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
column8: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.
column9: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.
column10: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
column11: Lurking in the shadowy corners of rooms, it awaits chances to steal its prey's life force.
column12: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.
column13: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
column14: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.
column15: You can hear tales told all over the world about how Gengar will pay a visit to children who are naughty.
column16: Even your home isn't safe. Gengar will lurk in whatever dark corner of a room it can find and wait for its chance to catch its prey.
column17: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!

column1: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to black-colored diamonds.
column2: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by <<0050digl>>.
column3: Its large body is over 26 feet long. Despite its size, it can squirm its way through the ground at 50 mph.
column4: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
column5: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
column6: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
column7: There is a magnet in its brain that prevents an Onix from losing direction while tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes steadily rounder and smoother.
column8: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.
column9: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
column10: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
column11: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
column12: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.
column13: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.

column1: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
column2: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
column3: It puts its enemy to sleep and eats the victim's dreams. Said to have descended from the legendary beast, Baku.
column4: If you think that you had a good dream but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
column5: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.
column6: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
column7: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat you dream through your nostrils.
column8: A descendant of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.
column9: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
column10: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with <<0517munn>> and <<0518mush>>.
column11: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it's ever eaten.
column12: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.
column13: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn't particularly like eating them.

column1: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
column2: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
column3: If you lock eyes with it, it will try to hypnotize you. It is best to close your eyes quickly before you get hypnotized.
column4: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.
column5: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
column6: The longer it swings its pendulum, the longer the effects of its hypnosis last.
column7: The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum in a Hypno's hand lull the foe into deep hypnosis. While searching for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
column8: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
column9: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
column10: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
column11: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.
column12: In Alola, <<0775koma>> is Hypno's main target. It rarely harms people.
column13: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can't sleep at night in hospitals.

column1: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
column2: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
column3: Lives on beaches and seashores. If a pincer falls off, a new, stronger pincer grows back in its place.
column4: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
column5: The pincers break off easily. If it loses a pincer, it somehow becomes incapable of walking sideways.
column6: If it is unable to find food, it will absorb nutrients by swallowing a mouthful of sand.
column7: Krabby live in holes dug into beaches. On sandy shores with little in the way of food, they can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
column8: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
